programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: 1992: East Carolina vs. North Carolina State
programme.desc: Classic 1992 Peach Bowl matchup from Atlanta, Ga., pitting the East Carolina Pirates against the North Carolina State Wolfpack. ECU wins 37-34. From Jan. 1, 1992.(n)

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Demetrius Allen shocked most of the fans in the Georgia Dome when he returned a kickoff 83 yards for a touchdown with 57 seconds left to allow 19th-ranked Virginia to avoid an embarrassment and defeat Georgia 34-27 in the Peach Bowl.(n)

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Chandler Catanzaro kicked a 37-yard field goal as time expired to give Clemson a wild win over Louisiana State in the Chick-fil-A Bowl. From Dec. 31, 2012.(n)

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.sub-title: Group Stage: Inter Miami CF vs. Orlando City SC
programme.desc: MLS returns with the inaugural Everglades Cup match between Orlando City SC and Inter Miami CF. The first game between the Sunshine State rivals opens the MLS is Back Tournament in central Florida. Inter Miami seek the franchise's first victory.(n)

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.sub-title: Group Stage: Chicago Fire vs. Nashville SC
programme.desc: Nashville and Chicago square off in the MLS is Back Tournament. NSC continue searching for their first MLS victory after dropping a pair of matches earlier in 2020. Music City SC have been moved to the Eastern Conference for scheduling purposes.(n)

programme.sub-title: Group Stage: Philadelphia Union vs. New York City FC

programme.title: Backstory
programme.desc: In July 2010, ESPN aired ``The Decision,'' a live primetime special in which LeBron James, the biggest NBA free agent ever, announced he was leaving Cleveland for Miami. The criticism was massive. Don Van Natta Jr. explores the far-reaching impact.(n)
